unitOperations.name: Biological Database
unitOperations.description: Retrieving and utilizing standardized biological parts from curated databases for use in downstream applications. This operation enables users to search, filter, and select genetic elements such as promoters, coding DNA sequences (CDS), and terminators, ensuring compatibility and adherence to established design standards in assembly and characterization.

unitOperations.name: DNA Oligomer Pool Design
unitOperations.description: A software package that designs DNA oligomers which are pooled in a single tube. It optimizes the selection and combination of oligomers for efficient DNA assembly and synthesis.

unitOperations.name: Primer Design
unitOperations.description: Designing primers regarding melting temperature and structure. The primers are used for mutant generation, PCR primers, and other molecular biology applications, ensuring specificity and efficiency in amplification.

unitOperations.name: Vector Design
unitOperations.description: Designing vector maps regarding inserts and a plasmid backbone. This might include primer design and DNA assembly processes, facilitating the construction of functional genetic vectors for cloning and expression.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Optimization
unitOperations.description: Modifying codon usage of a DNA sequence to maximize protein expression in a specific host. This software ensures optimal translation efficiency and protein yield by adapting sequences to host-specific codon preferences.

unitOperations.name: Synthesis Screening
unitOperations.description: Tools for screening potentially dangerous DNA sequences. These tools help ensure biosafety by identifying sequences that may pose risks in synthetic biology applications.

unitOperations.name: Structure-based Sequence Generation
unitOperations.description: Generating sequences based on protein structures using AI models. This software aids in designing novel proteins with desired structural and functional properties.

unitOperations.name: Protein Structure Prediction
unitOperations.description: Predicting protein structures using AI models. These tools provide insights into protein folding and stability, supporting protein engineering and drug discovery efforts.

unitOperations.name: Protein Structure Generation
unitOperations.description: Generating protein structures using AI models. This software facilitates the design of new proteins and enzymes with specific catalytic or binding functions.

unitOperations.name: Retrosynthetic Pathway Design
unitOperations.description: To predict biosynthetic pathways using tools for checking reaction feasibilities and for novel pathway discovery. These tools support metabolic engineering by identifying efficient routes for chemical synthesis.

unitOperations.name: Enzyme Identification
unitOperations.description: To search for enzymes from databases or to predict enzyme properties such as reactivities for selecting proper enzymes in pathways. This software aids in enzyme discovery and characterization for biocatalysis.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Alignment
unitOperations.description: Exploring and comparing sequence similarity using alignment algorithms. These tools are essential for identifying homologous sequences and understanding evolutionary relationships.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Trimming and Filtering
unitOperations.description: Preprocessing for removing low-quality long/short-read sequences. This step is crucial for ensuring data quality in sequencing projects.

unitOperations.name: Read Mapping and Alignment
unitOperations.description: Mapping long/short-read sequences to reference sequences. These tools are used for genome assembly, variant calling, and transcriptomics.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Assembly
unitOperations.description: Assembling long/short-read sequences for complete gene, pathway, and chromosome. This software supports the reconstruction of genomes and metagenomes.

unitOperations.name: Metagenomic Assembly
unitOperations.description: Assembling metagenomic data to reconstruct genomes from complex microbial communities. This software supports environmental and clinical metagenomics studies.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Quality Control
unitOperations.description: Performing quality control (QC) on long/short-read fastq and fast5 files. QC is essential for identifying and correcting errors in sequencing data.

unitOperations.name: Demultiplexing
unitOperations.description: Separating NGS reads based on native or user-defined barcodes. This process is critical for handling multiplexed sequencing data.

unitOperations.name: Variant Calling
unitOperations.description: Detecting variants based on read mapping. These tools are used for identifying SNPs, indels, and structural variants in genomic data.

unitOperations.name: RNA-Seq Analysis
unitOperations.description: Processing and analyzing transcriptomic data to quantify gene expression levels, identify splice variants, and detect differential gene expression. This software supports functional genomics studies.

unitOperations.name: Gene Set Enrichment Analysis
unitOperations.description: Analyzing gene expression data to identify enriched biological pathways. This software supports functional genomics and systems biology research.

unitOperations.name: Proteomics Data Analysis
unitOperations.description: Processing and interpreting data from mass spectrometry to identify and quantify proteins, understand modifications, and assess protein interactions. These tools are essential for proteomics research.

unitOperations.name: Phylogenetic Analysis
unitOperations.description: Determining the evolutionary relationships among species or sequences by constructing phylogenetic trees based on sequence similarities and differences. This software supports evolutionary biology studies.

unitOperations.name: Metabolic Flux Analysis
unitOperations.description: Modeling and analyzing metabolic pathways, providing insights into cellular metabolism and pathway optimization. These tools are used for metabolic engineering and systems biology.

unitOperations.name: Deep Learning Data Preparation
unitOperations.description: Preparing and batching datasets for AI model training and evaluation. This software supports machine learning workflows in bioinformatics.

unitOperations.name: Sequence Embedding
unitOperations.description: Biological sequence embedding procedure. This process is used for transforming sequences into numerical representations for machine learning applications.

unitOperations.name: Deep Learning Model Training
unitOperations.description: Model training procedure using training data. This software supports the development of AI models for various bioinformatics tasks.

unitOperations.name: Model Evaluation
unitOperations.description: Utilizing model evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, etc.). This software is used for assessing the performance of machine learning models.

unitOperations.name: Hyperparameter Tuning
unitOperations.description: Efficiently exploring the search space using Bayesian optimization techniques. This software supports the optimization of machine learning models.

unitOperations.name: Model Deployment
unitOperations.description: Deploying trained models as services. This software supports the integration of AI models into production environments.

unitOperations.name: Monitoring and Reporting
unitOperations.description: Monitoring and visualizing performance and resource usage of AI models. This software supports the maintenance and optimization of deployed models.

unitOperations.name: Phenotype Data Preprocessing
unitOperations.description: Preprocessing measured and collected phenotype data. It involves cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw phenotype datasets for downstream analysis.

unitOperations.name: XCMS Analysis
unitOperations.description: Analyzing and visualizing chromatographically separated and single-spectra mass spectral data. This software supports metabolomics research.

unitOperations.name: Flow Cytometry Analysis
unitOperations.description: Analyzing and visualizing flow cytometry data. This software supports immunology and cell biology research.

unitOperations.name: DNA Assembly Simulation
unitOperations.description: Simulating DNA assembly such as Golden Gate and Gibson for increasing assembly success rate. This software supports synthetic biology and genetic engineering.

unitOperations.name: Gene Editing Simulation
unitOperations.description: Simulating gene editing outcomes using CRISPR technology. This software helps predict off-target effects and optimize guide RNA design for precise genome editing.

unitOperations.name: Well Plate Mapping
unitOperations.description: Software for mapping well plate source plates to destination plates. This tool supports high-throughput screening and assay development.

unitOperations.name: Computation
unitOperations.description: A general process of data collection, preprocessing, and analysis steps. This software supports a wide range of bioinformatics and computational biology applications.
